intro: Botrychium lunaria var. rhombeum, commonly known as the moonwort, is a small, fern-like plant belonging to the family Ophioglossaceae. It is characterized by its unique, two-part sporophyll structure, with the upper portion resembling a shield and the lower portion forming a spore-producing structure. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodland floors or rocky crevices. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a distinctive, delicate appearance. Botrychium lunaria var. rhombeum is a rare and ancient species, often found in temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere.
